content.description:
The top of this little, steep line is the crux, and there is a really cool pocket up there as the problems namesake. 

  Find the lowball dihedral under the steepness and sit-start matched in the lowest rail. Bump to the higher rail and climb out from the roof. Use the high pocket and the further sloper/edge to finish.

Bear's Den is one of the most recognizable features on the BoB. A huge cap-stone resting on top of two supporting smaller blocks. The cap-stone forms the roof of the "bear's den" and the deep cave certainly seems like a logical location for bears, although I have yet to find any.  

  The Bear's Den Block is the easily dismissed, lowball but very steep undercut block to the right of the main boulder with one single better-than-it-looks line.
